fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Policies in the fields of the construction industry, employment and labour market, posting of workers, migrant workers, energy savings, works councils, occupational health and safety
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
The European Federation of Building and Woodworkers (EFBWW) is the European Industry Federation for the construction industry, the building materials industry, the wood and furniture industry and the forestry industry. The EFBWW has 76 affiliated unions in 34 countries and represents a total of 2,000,000 members, see 
http://www.efbww.org/default.asp?Language=EN
goals__remit: BAT coordinates and represents the member organisations'  (3F, Blik & Rørarbejderforbundet, El-forbundet, HK/Privat, Malerforbundet, Dansk Metal og Teknisk Landsforbund) interests on working environment, co-determination, AS, Works Councils and EWC, industrial policy, housing policy and labour market polity , international work, posted workers, foreign companies and Greenland.
